author: chfast
content: <@393119312350543872> Are you still working on the tool to dump block/tx from live network to blokchain tests format?

author: dimitry8570
content: No, that was a prototype. I believe it was also refactored a lot since then

author: danceratopz
content:
It only works for legacy transactions. The example provided does work and fills. 

```bash
uv run gentest -c config.json 0xa41f343be7a150b740e5c939fa4d89f3a2850dbe21715df96b612fc20d1906be tests/paris/test_0xa41f.py
fill tests/paris/test_0xa41f.py
```
(this comes from a slightly corrected - due to uv - docstring of `src/cli/gentest.py`).

We should really pick this up if it'd be useful to you. I assume you're not interested in legacy transactions, do you have a particular tx hash you'd like to generate a test for?

author: chfast
content: By legacy you mean pre gas burn?

author: chfast
content: What I want to do with this is dump a whole sequence of block into single blockchain tests. Likely some recent blocks. This can be a good performance test for EVM with real word data. But I don't think you should develop it for me. But having the tool in EEST sounds link a good place.
